result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnathon C Coleman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM2058, 16CM88 and 15CM2277 called: 10:02am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person and with Atty Jim Kurszewski  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
15CM2058>>D&RI entire file
15CM2277 - Cts. 2, 4, and 5>>D&RI
16CM88 - Cts. 2, 4, and 5>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CM2277 - Ct. 1 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST
15CM2277 - Ct. 3 (Poss Controlled Substance)>>NO CONTEST
16CM88 - Ct. 1 (DC)>>NO CONTEST
16CM88 - Ct. 3 (Misd BJ)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS:  
15CM2277 - Ct. 1>> 90 days MCJ 
15CM2277 - Ct. 3>>30 days MCJ
16CM88 - Ct. 1>>90 days MCJ
16CM88 - Ct. 3>>90 days MCJ
>>All sentences w/huber for work/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, to begin within 45 days.
>>All sentences CONCURRENT to each other
>>Credit for 3 days of time already served in each count
>>Defendant to pay CC on each count, and D.A. surcharge in 15CM2277 Ct. 1; One DNA sample and surcharges on each file to be paid

Adj: 10:13am

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM2277 and 15CM2058 called: 1:57pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Kurszewski.


Parties note agreement has NOT been reached in this matter.
COURT questions parties as to discovery and if any motions will be filed before trial; Parties state no issues on discovery and no further issues court will need to decide.

COURT leaves FPT/JT dates on court's calendar
Bond continues.

Adj: 1:59pm
Defendant appeared; wants Public Defender; advised to go to their office.

Plea hearing at 12-22-2015 01:50 pm.
Final pre-trial at 01-21-2016 10:00 am.
Jury Trial at 02-23-2016 09:00 am.
No controlled substances w/o a valid prescription and only in amount prescribed.
